verbs.description: smoodge (third-person singular simple present smoodges, present participle smoodging, simple past and past participle smoodged)

entries.meaning: (Australia) To act in an ingratiating manner; to fawn.
examples: Mr Grant, in reply, was not in favor of the way the bureau was conducted. There was no rotation system, but a straight-out smoodging system, and therein was his objection. Give us the bureau, but let there be no smoodging to the foreman.

entries.meaning: (Australia, slang, dated) To kiss and cuddle; to canoodle.
